portfolioImage.title: Legatum Capital: part of the Legatum Portfolio

entry.portfolioIntro: Legatum Capital invests in listed and private businesses with a focus on the consumer, technology and finance sectors.

portfolioBlocks.heading: Overview
portfolioBlocks.text:
Legatum Capital invests in well-run businesses across a range of sectors, primarily focusing on consumer, technology and financial services.

Led by Philip Vassiliou, CIO and Partner at Legatum, the team’s investment decisions are geographically agnostic. The core of Legatum's investment strategy centres around allocating proprietary capital into a concentrated portfolio of businesses that is expected to deliver value over the long-term.

portfolioBlocks.heading: Background
portfolioBlocks.text:
All four founding partners of Legatum come from a long history of working in the investment and banking industries in different markets across the globe.

Immediately before establishing the company, Philip had worked together with Mark Stoleson and Alan McCormick at Sovereign Global, an investment firm founded by Christopher Chandler and his brother in 1986, that specialised in long-term value creation. Before that, Philip worked for the Government of Dubai and at Goldman Sachs.

Sovereign Global is recognised by many as having one of the best long-term track records in the investing world and was instrumental in establishing good governance principles in some of the embryonic financial markets of the time.

portfolioBlocks.heading: Approach
portfolioBlocks.text:
Legatum Capital’s investment strategy is relatively simple: it manages a very concentrated portfolio, typically consisting of between 5 to 10 high-quality businesses, holding positions which are “long only” and usually without significant debt. Our investment business is primarily focused in the public equity markets.

Investment decisions are made by looking at each opportunity and working to understand the intrinsic value of each business. The team places great emphasis on world-class leadership, organisational culture, robust competitive advantages, secular growth and free cash flow generation.

Success is evaluated by measuring growth in intrinsic value over years rather than share price performance over quarters. This has resulted in a portfolio with an average holding period of more than three years.

person.title: Philip Vassiliou
person.personShortBio: Philip co-founded Legatum. He leads the investment team and is also Chair of the Luminos Fund
person.personFullBiography:
Philip Vassiliou is the Chief Investment Officer and a Partner of Legatum. He has been with the firm since its inception in 2006 and is primarily responsible for the oversight of Legatum’s capital markets activities. Philip is also Chair of the Luminos Fund, a philanthropic initiative founded by Legatum which is dedicated to advancing education innovations for the world’s most vulnerable children.

Prior to Legatum, Philip previously worked for the Dubai Development Investment Authority, and in the Equities & Private Wealth divisions of Goldman Sachs in New York and London.

Philip holds a Bachelor of Science from Babson College.

highlights.text: Philip is the Chief Investment Officer and a Partner of Legatum.

highlights.heading: Trailblazers
highlights.text: Legatum's predecessor, Sovereign Global, was among the first significant foreign public equity investors in Brazil, Russia and South Korea.

entry.title: Principles
entry.metaDescription: Our principles have been shaped over decades and will continue to evolve with our experience and the changing landscape in which we are operating

portfolioPeople.title: Philip Vassiliou
portfolioPeople.personShortBio: Philip co-founded Legatum. He leads the investment team and is also Chair of the Luminos Fund
portfolioPeople.personFullBiography:
Philip Vassiliou is the Chief Investment Officer and a Partner of Legatum. He has been with the firm since its inception in 2006 and is primarily responsible for the oversight of Legatum’s capital markets activities. Philip is also Chair of the Luminos Fund, a philanthropic initiative founded by Legatum which is dedicated to advancing education innovations for the world’s most vulnerable children.

Prior to Legatum, Philip previously worked for the Dubai Development Investment Authority, and in the Equities & Private Wealth divisions of Goldman Sachs in New York and London.

Philip holds a Bachelor of Science from Babson College.

portfolioPeople.title: David Matthew
portfolioPeople.personShortBio: David joined Legatum in 2012 as Head of Trading after working in Europe for several years
portfolioPeople.personFullBiography:
David Matthew is the Head of Trading at Legatum.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2012, David was the Head of Trading at Montrica Investment Management and the Head of European Trading at TPG-Axon Capital Management. David also worked in various roles at Caxton Europe Asset Management and Deutsche Bank.

David holds a BA in Economics from the University of California-Irvine and is a CFA Charterholder.

portfolioPeople.title: Michel Al-Moumen
portfolioPeople.personShortBio: Michel joined Legatum in 2018 as an Investment Analyst, moving to Dubai from New York
portfolioPeople.personFullBiography:
Michel Al-Moumen is an Investment Analyst at Legatum, responsible for research and analysis of existing and potential holdings.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2018, Michel was a Consultant at global investment fund, Tiger Global Management, based in New York.

Michel holds an MBA in Finance and Accounting and a BScE in Finance and Real Estate at the Wharton School, and a BA in International Studies from the College of Arts and Sciences, both at the University of Pennsylvania.

portfolioPeople.title: Dakota Morrell
portfolioPeople.personShortBio: Dakota joined Legatum in 2020 as an Investment Analyst, moving from J.P. Morgan in New York
portfolioPeople.personFullBiography:
Dakota Morrell is an Investment Analyst at Legatum, responsible for helping Legatum Capital with research and investment diligence.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2020, Dakota was an Investment Banking Analyst at J.P. Morgan, based in New York.

Dakota holds a Bachelor’s Degree with Distinction in Commerce from the University of Virginia, McIntire School of Commerce.

portfolioPeople.title: Imran Weldingwala
portfolioPeople.personShortBio: Imran joined Legatum in 2024 as a Research Analyst
portfolioPeople.personFullBiography:
Imran Weldingwala is a Research Analyst at Legatum, responsible for research and investment diligence.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2024, Imran was an Investment Banking Analyst at Evercore, based in London. Imran holds a First Class Bachelor’s Degree in Philosophy, Politics, and Economics from the University of Warwick.

relatedArticles.metaDescription: Following an unprecedented legal challenge, Chris Bryant MP retracts false claims about Christopher Chandler first made in Parliament﻿.

relatedArticles.title: Abundance of opportunities for investors in India
relatedArticles.metaDescription: Legatum's Chief Investment Officer meets India's Finance Minister in the USA to discuss investment opportunities and the vital role foreign investors play.

relatedArticles.title: MPL becomes a unicorn
relatedArticles.metaDescription: Mobile esports platform Mobile Premier League raises Series E round of funding from Legatum Capital at a pre-money valuation of $2.3 billion USD.
